sen.j: 加悦谷（かやだに）は京都府丹後地方、大江山連峰と江笠連峰に囲まれた扇状地。
sen.e: Kayadani is an alluvial fan surrounded on two sides by the Oeyama mountain range and Egasa mountain range in the Tango region, Kyoto Prefecture.
Kayadani is an alluvial fan surrounded on two sides by the Oeyama and Egasa mountain range in the Tango region, Kyoto Prefecture.
Kayadani is an alluvial fan surrounded on two sides by the Oeyama and Egasa mountain range in the Tango region, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 加悦谷を南北に流れる野田川が、日本三景の一つである天橋立の内海（阿蘇海）に注ぎ込む。
sen.e: Noda-gawa River running through Kayadani from north to south runs into the inland sea (Aso-kai) of Amanohashidate, one of the three most scenic spots in Japan.
Noda-gawa River runs through Kayadani from north to south runs into the inland sea (Aso-kai) of Amanohashidate, and is one of the three most scenic spots in Japan.
Noda-gawa River runs through Kayadani from north to south runs into the inland sea (Aso-kai) of Amanohashidate, and is one of the three most scenic spots in Japan.

sen.j: その豊かな水源を用い、丹後ちりめんが基幹産業になっている。
sen.e: Tango chirimen (silk crepe) using its abundant water resources is a key industry.
Tango chirimen (silk crepe) is a key industry, and takes advantage of the abundant water resources.
Tango chirimen (silk crepe) is a key industry, and takes advantage of the abundant water resources.

sen.j: 2006年(平成18年)3月には加悦谷3町が市町村合併し、与謝野町が誕生した。
sen.e: In March 2006, Yosano-cho was formed as a result of merging three towns in Kayadani.
In March 2006, Yosano-cho was formed as a result of merging three towns in Kayadani.
In March 2006, Yosano-cho was formed as a result of merging three towns in Kayadani.

sen.cmt: スペルミスを修正しました。
スペルミスを修正し、表記をchoに統一しました。
表記をchoに統一しました。
表記をchoに統一しました。
